text: How have you included `MyExample2` in the REPL?

The Module is created in C:\Users\...\.julia\dev\MyExample2
When I try just using MyExample2 it did not work:
`julia> using MyExample2`
`ERROR: ArgumentError: Package MyExample2 not found in current path:`
`- Run `import Pkg; Pkg.add("MyExample2")` to install the MyExample2 package.`
`Stacktrace:`
 `[1] require(::Module, ::Symbol) at .\loading.jl:893`

Then by trial and error I found out if I activate the environment (via right click on folder in  JuliaPro) using MyExample2 it works

Julia finds the module?

text:
When I comment out the function definition in externf.jl then Julia notices this and finds no definition.
This makes sense since in Step 4, the modifications in f1,f2 were also noticed.
So it seems that `include("externf.jl")`  somehow can't be reversed... once it is included it always stays included.

I tried exporting my_f1:
`export my_f1` has the same behaviour.. once exported it can't be reversed by commenting that line out.

I would have to restart REPL in this case
